text: Who is traditionally understood to be the author of 1 John?
options: The Apostle John, son of Zebedee
verseText: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we looked upon and have touched with our hands, concerning the word of life... that which we have seen and heard we proclaim also to you...

text: 1 John provides tests or assurances for believers to know what?
options: That they have eternal life and fellowship with God
verseText: I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life.

text: What does 1 John 1:9 promise if we confess our sins?
options: God is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness
We will no longer be tempted
verseText: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

text: According to 1 John 2, how can we know that we know God?
verseText: And by this we know that we have come to know him, if we keep his commandments.

text: What command does John emphasize repeatedly throughout the letter, calling it both old and new?
verseText: Beloved, I am writing you no new commandment, but an old commandment that you had from the beginning... At the same time, it is a new commandment that I am writing to you... For this is the message that you have heard from the beginning, that we should love one another... Beloved, let us love one another... And this commandment we have from him: whoever loves God must also love his brother.

text: What does John warn believers not to love (1 John 2)?
options: The world or the things in the world
verseText: Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

text: How does John define sin in 1 John 3:4?
verseText: Everyone who makes a practice of sinning also practices lawlessness; sin is lawlessness.

text: What is a key test John gives to discern whether a spirit is from God (1 John 4)?
options: Whether it acknowledges that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
verseText: By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God, and every spirit that does not confess Jesus is not from God. This is the spirit of the antichrist...

text: What famous statement about God's nature is found in 1 John 4:8 and 4:16?
verseText: Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love... So we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.

text: According to 1 John 5, what overcomes the world?
verseText: For everyone who has been born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the worldâ€”our faith.
